hints.content: To divide a shape in thirds, we divide the whole into **$3$ equal parts**.

This rectangle is divided into $3$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size: 
 
![A rectangle has 2 angled lines going from the top center to the bottom corners dividing it into 3 parts. 2 parts are equal but the third part is larger.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6eca7ed68e627a58d87d9de680959f195737d28)

These rectangles are divided into $4$ pieces:  

![A rectangle with 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6baac19c2669c59c25e918a0e2a493307575eb36)

![A rectangle with 3 parallel diagonal lines dividing it into 4 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b5a20c1e6195d6a988c0b0e6efa418b6cc4e118e)

This rectangle is divided into thirds:  

![A rectangle has 2 parallel lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/460f2eac392bdb8d9636c3f1a60fc17d6a032344)

question.content:
**Which rectangles are divided into thirds?**  

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle has 2 parallel lines dividing it into 3 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/460f2eac392bdb8d9636c3f1a60fc17d6a032344)

![A rectangle has 2 angled lines going from the top center to the bottom corners dividing it into 3 parts. 2 parts are equal but the third part is larger.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6eca7ed68e627a58d87d9de680959f195737d28)
![A rectangle with 2 diagonal lines from opposite corners dividing it into 4 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6baac19c2669c59c25e918a0e2a493307575eb36)
![A rectangle with 3 parallel diagonal lines dividing it into 4 parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b5a20c1e6195d6a988c0b0e6efa418b6cc4e118e)
